meanings.definition: Engaged in or characterized by scrambling or scratching for something.
meanings.sent1: The kids became scrabblier as they searched for hidden Easter eggs in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel was scrabblier than usual as it tried to climb the slippery tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's scrabblier behavior while digging in the sand made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The monkeys in the zoo were scrabblier than ever, trying to reach the bananas hanging high.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the raccoon's scrabblier paws against the wooden fence echoed in the quiet night.

meanings.definition: More difficult or challenging to play in the game of Scrabble.
meanings.sent1: The expert level of the new Scrabble app is much scrabblier than the beginner level.
meanings.sent2: The final round of the Scrabble tournament was the scrabblier match they had ever played.
meanings.sent3: Trying to come up with a word with all vowels in Scrabble felt scrabblier than expected.
meanings.sent4: The last few moves of the game became scrabblier as both players ran out of good options.
meanings.sent5: The board layout made it even scrabblier to find a spot for the triple word score.
